summary: Baja California, officially the Free and Sovereign State of Baja California, is a state in northern and western Mexico. It was once called the North Territory of Baja California before becoming a state in 1952. The state includes the northern half of the Baja California peninsula and Guadalupe Island. It borders the U.S. state of California to the north and the Gulf of California to the east. With an area of 27,071 square miles, it is Mexico's 12th-largest state. Over 75% of its population lives in the cities of Mexicali, Ensenada, and Tijuana. The state's diverse geography includes beaches, forests, deserts, and mountains, with the Sierra de Baja California as its backbone.
title: Baja California
